intro: Pteroneurum corsicum, commonly known as the Corsican pteroneurum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
